alert.note: Alert for Northern Warren; Northern Washington; Southeast Warren (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 20 at 1:56PM EST by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A BAND OF HEAVY SNOW WILL AFFECT PARTS OF NORTHERN WASHINGTON... SOUTHERN WASHINGTON...SOUTHEAST WARREN...NORTHERN WARREN...AND NORTHERN SARATOGA COUNTIES... HAZARDS...A band of heavy snow accompanied by winds of up to 30 MPH which can rapidly reduce visibility to less than one mile. LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 156 PM EST, a band of heavy snow was near Lake Luzerne Campground, or 10 miles southwest of Lake George Village moving east at 40 MPH. THIS BAND OF HEAVY SNOW WILL BE NEAR... Lake Luzerne-Hadley and Lake Luzerne Campground around 200 PM EST. Corinth around 205 PM EST. Lake George Village around 210 PM EST. Glens Falls, West Glens Falls and Glens Falls North around 215 PM EST. Hudson Falls and Fort Edward around 220 PM EST. This includes Interstate 87 between exits 17S and 22. SAFETY INFO... Use extra caution if you must travel into or through this band of heavy snow. Rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads may lead to accidents. &&

area.areaDesc: Northern Warren; Northern Washington; Southeast Warren
